z-app/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-app/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component

z-app/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-app-bar/absolute.description: Applies position: absolute to the component.

z-app-bar/app.description: Designates the component as part of the application layout. Used for dynamically adjusting content sizing. Components using this prop should reside **outside** of `v-main` component to function properly. You can find more information about layouts on the [application page](/components/application). **Note:** this prop automatically applies **position: fixed** to the layout element. You can overwrite this functionality by using the `absolute` prop

z-app-bar/bottom.description: Aligns the component towards the bottom.

z-app-bar/clipped-left.description: Designates that the application's `v-navigation-drawer` that is positioned on the left is below the app-bar.

z-app-bar/clipped-right.description: Designates that the application's `v-navigation-drawer` that is positioned on the right is below the app-bar.

z-app-bar/collapse.description: Puts the toolbar into a collapsed state reducing its maximum width.

z-app-bar/collapse-on-scroll.description: Puts the app-bar into a collapsed state when scrolling.

z-app-bar/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-app-bar/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-app-bar/dense.description: Reduces the height of the toolbar content to 48px (96px when using the **prominent** prop).

z-app-bar/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

z-app-bar/extended.description: Use this prop to increase the height of the toolbar _without_ using the `extension` slot for adding content. May be used in conjunction with the **extension-height** prop, and any of the other props that affect the height of the toolbar, e.g. **prominent**, **dense**, etc., **WITH THE EXCEPTION** of **height**.

z-app-bar/extension-height.description: Specify an explicit height for the `extension` slot.

z-app-bar/fade-img-on-scroll.description: When using the **src** prop or `img` slot, will fade the image when scrolling.

z-app-bar/height.description: Designates a specific height for the toolbar. Overrides the heights imposed by other props, e.g. **prominent**, **dense**, **extended**, etc.

z-app-bar/hide-on-scroll.description: Hides the app-bar when scrolling. Will still show the `extension` slot.

z-app-bar/inverted-scroll.description: Hides the app-bar when scrolling down and displays it when scrolling up.

z-app-bar/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-app-bar/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

z-app-bar/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-app-bar/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

z-app-bar/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

z-app-bar/outlined.description: Removes elevation (box-shadow) and adds a *thin* border.

z-app-bar/prominent.description: Increases the height of the toolbar content to 128px.

z-app-bar/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

z-app-bar/scroll-off-screen.description: Hides the app-bar when scrolling. Will **NOT** show the `extension` slot.

z-app-bar/scroll-target.description: Designates the element to target for scrolling events. Uses `window` by default.

z-app-bar/scroll-threshold.description: The amount of scroll distance down before **hide-on-scroll** activates.

z-app-bar/shaped.description: Applies a large border radius on the top left and bottom right of the card.

z-app-bar/short.description: Reduce the height of the toolbar content to 56px (112px when using the **prominent** prop).

z-app-bar/shrink-on-scroll.description: Shrinks a **prominent** toolbar to a **dense** or **short** (default) one when scrolling.

z-app-bar/src.description: Specifies a [v-img](/components/images) as the component's background.

z-app-bar/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-app-bar/value.description: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.

z-app-bar/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-alert/border.description: Puts a border on the alert. Accepts **top** \| **right** \| **bottom** \| **left**.

z-alert/close-icon.description: Change the default icon used for **dismissible** alerts.

z-alert/close-label.description: Text used for *aria-label* on **dismissible** alerts. Can also be customizing globally in [Internationalization](/customization/internationalization).

z-alert/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-alert/colored-border.description: Applies the defined **color** to the alert's border.

z-alert/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-alert/dismissible.description: Adds a close icon that can hide the alert.

z-alert/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

z-alert/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

z-alert/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-alert/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

z-alert/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-alert/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

z-alert/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

z-alert/mode.description: Sets the transition mode (does not apply to transition-group). You can find more information on the Vue documentation [for transition modes](https://vuejs.org/v2/api/#transition).

z-alert/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

z-alert/outlined.description: Makes the background transparent and applies a thin border.

z-alert/prominent.description: Displays a larger vertically centered icon to draw more attention.

z-alert/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

z-alert/shaped.description: Applies a large border radius on the top left and bottom right of the card.

z-alert/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-alert/text.description: Applies the defined **color** to text and a low opacity background of the same.

z-alert/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in transitions](/styles/transitions) or one your own.

z-alert/type.description: Specify a **success**, **info**, **warning** or **error** alert. Uses the contextual color and has a pre-defined icon.

z-alert/value.description: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.

z-alert/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-autocomplete/allow-overflow.description: Allow the menu to overflow off the screen

z-autocomplete/append-icon.description: Appends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-autocomplete/append-outer-icon.description: Appends an icon to the outside the component's input, uses same syntax as `v-icon`

z-autocomplete/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element that this component should detach to. String can be any valid querySelector and Object can be any valid Node. This will attach to the root `v-app` component by default.

z-autocomplete/auto-select-first.description: When searching, will always highlight the first option

z-autocomplete/background-color.description: Changes the background-color of the input

z-autocomplete/cache-items.description: Keeps a local _unique_ copy of all items that have been passed through the **items** prop.

z-autocomplete/chips.description: Changes display of selections to chips

z-autocomplete/clear-icon.description: Applied when using **clearable** and the input is dirty

z-autocomplete/clearable.description: Add input clear functionality, default icon is Material Design Icons **mdi-clear**

z-autocomplete/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-autocomplete/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

z-autocomplete/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. This will default the components color to _white_ unless you've configured your [application theme](/customization/theme) to **dark** or if you are using the **color** prop on the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-autocomplete/deletable-chips.description: Adds a remove icon to selected chips

z-autocomplete/eager.description: Will force the components content to render on mounted. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

z-autocomplete/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state

z-autocomplete/error-count.description: The total number of errors that should display at once

z-autocomplete/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation

z-autocomplete/filled.description: Applies the alternate filled input style

z-autocomplete/filter.description: The filtering algorithm used when searching. [example](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/blob/master/packages/vuetify/src/components/VAutocomplete/VAutocomplete.ts#L40)

z-autocomplete/flat.description: Removes elevation (shadow) added to element when using the **solo** or **solo-inverted** props

z-autocomplete/height.description: Sets the height of the input

z-autocomplete/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display

z-autocomplete/hide-no-data.description: Hides the menu when there are no options to show.  Useful for preventing the menu from opening before results are fetched asynchronously.  Also has the effect of opening the menu when the `items` array changes if not already open.

z-autocomplete/hide-selected.description: Do not display in the select menu items that are already selected

z-autocomplete/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component

z-autocomplete/item-value.description: Set property of **items**'s value - **must be primitive**. Dot notation is supported. **Note:** This is currently not supported with `v-combobox` [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/issues/5479)

z-autocomplete/items.description: Can be an array of objects or array of strings. When using objects, will look for a text, value and disabled keys. This can be changed using the **item-text**, **item-value** and **item-disabled** props.  Objects that have a **header** or **divider** property are considered special cases and generate a list header or divider; these items are not selectable.

z-autocomplete/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-autocomplete/loader-height.description: Specifies the height of the loader

z-autocomplete/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color

z-autocomplete/menu-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-menu` component. Accepts either a string for boolean props `menu-props="auto, overflowY"`, or an object `:menu-props="{ auto: true, overflowY: true }"`

z-autocomplete/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or message if using a string

z-autocomplete/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value

z-autocomplete/no-data-text.description: Display text when there is no data

z-autocomplete/no-filter.description: Do not apply filtering when searching. Useful when data is being filtered server side

z-autocomplete/open-on-clear.description: When using the **clearable** prop, once cleared, the select menu will either open or stay open, depending on the current state

z-autocomplete/outlined.description: Applies the outlined style to the input

z-autocomplete/persistent-hint.description: Forces hint to always be visible

z-autocomplete/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible

z-autocomplete/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-autocomplete/prepend-inner-icon.description: Prepends an icon inside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-autocomplete/return-object.description: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**

z-autocomplete/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input

z-autocomplete/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`

z-autocomplete/search-input.description: Search value. Can be used with `.sync` modifier.

z-autocomplete/shaped.description: Round if `outlined` and increase `border-radius` if `filled`. Must be used with either `outlined` or `filled`

z-autocomplete/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty

z-autocomplete/small-chips.description: Changes display of selections to chips with the **small** property

z-autocomplete/solo.description: Changes the style of the input

z-autocomplete/success.description: Puts the input in a manual success state

z-autocomplete/success-messages.description: Puts the input in a success state and passes through custom success messages.

z-autocomplete/value-comparator.description: The comparison algorithm used for values. [More info](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/blob/master/packages/vuetify/src/util/helpers.ts)

z-avatar/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-avatar/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

z-avatar/left.description: Designates that the avatar is on the left side of a component. This is hooked into by components such as [v-chip](/components/chips) and [v-btn](/components/buttons).

z-avatar/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

z-avatar/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-avatar/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

z-avatar/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

z-avatar/right.description: Designates that the avatar is on the right side of a component. This is hooked into by components such as [v-chip](/components/chips) and [v-btn](/components/buttons).

z-avatar/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

z-avatar/size.description: Sets the height and width of the component.

z-avatar/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-badge/avatar.description: Removes badge padding for the use of the `v-avatar` in the **badge** slot.

z-badge/bordered.description: Applies a **2px** by default and **1.5px** border around the badge when using the **dot** property.

z-badge/bottom.description: Aligns the component towards the bottom.

z-badge/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-badge/content.description: Any content you want injected as text into the badge.

z-badge/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-badge/dot.description: Reduce the size of the badge and hide its contents

z-badge/icon.description: Designates a specific icon used in the badge.

z-badge/inline.description: Moves the badge to be inline with the wrapping element. Supports the usage of the **left** prop.

z-badge/left.description: Aligns the component towards the left.

z-badge/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-badge/mode.description: Sets the transition mode (does not apply to transition-group). You can find more information on the Vue documentation [for transition modes](https://vuejs.org/v2/api/#transition).

z-badge/offset-x.description: Offset the badge on the x-axis.

z-badge/offset-y.description: Offset the badge on the y-axis.

z-badge/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

z-badge/overlap.description: Overlaps the slotted content on top of the component.

z-badge/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in transitions](/styles/transitions) or one your own.

z-badge/value.description: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.

z-banner/app.description: When used inside of `v-main`, will calculate top based upon application `v-toolbar` and `v-system-bar`.

z-banner/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-banner/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-banner/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

z-banner/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

z-banner/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-banner/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

z-banner/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-banner/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

z-banner/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

z-banner/mobile-breakpoint.description: Sets the designated mobile breakpoint for the component.

z-banner/outlined.description: Removes elevation (box-shadow) and adds a *thin* border.

z-banner/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

z-banner/shaped.description: Applies a large border radius on the top left and bottom right of the card.

z-banner/single-line.description: Forces the banner onto a single line.

z-banner/sticky.description: Applies **position: sticky** to the component (**Evergreen browsers only**). You can find more information on the [MDN documentation for sticky position](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/position).

z-banner/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-banner/value.description: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.

z-banner/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-bottom-navigation/active-class.description: The class applied to a [v-btn](/components/buttons) when activated.

z-bottom-navigation/app.description: Designates the component as part of the application layout. Used for dynamically adjusting content sizing. Components using this prop should reside **outside** of `v-main` component to function properly. You can find more information about layouts on the [application page](/components/application). **Note:** this prop automatically applies **position: fixed** to the layout element. You can overwrite this functionality by using the `absolute` prop

z-bottom-navigation/background-color.description: Changes the background-color for the component.

z-bottom-navigation/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-bottom-navigation/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-bottom-navigation/grow.description: Force [v-btn](/components/buttons)s to take up all available space.

z-bottom-navigation/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

z-bottom-navigation/hide-on-scroll.description: Will transition the navigation off screen when scrolling up.

z-bottom-navigation/horizontal.description: Uses an alternative horizontal styling for [v-btn](/components/buttons).

z-bottom-navigation/input-value.description: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden. Supports the **.sync** modifier.

z-bottom-navigation/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-bottom-navigation/mandatory.description: Forces a value to always be selected (if available).

z-bottom-navigation/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

z-bottom-navigation/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-bottom-navigation/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

z-bottom-navigation/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

z-bottom-navigation/scroll-target.description: Designates the element to target for scrolling events. Uses `window` by default.

z-bottom-navigation/scroll-threshold.description: The amount of scroll distance down before **hide-on-scroll** activates.

z-bottom-navigation/shift.description: Hides text of [v-btn](/components/buttons)s when they are not active.

z-bottom-navigation/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-bottom-navigation/value.description: Holds the value of the currently active [v-btn](/components/buttons). If the button has no value supplied, its index will be used instead..

z-bottom-navigation/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-bottom-sheet/activator.description: Designate a custom activator when the `activator` slot is not used. String can be any valid querySelector and Object can be any valid Node.

z-bottom-sheet/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element that this component should detach to. String can be any valid querySelector and Object can be any valid Node. This will attach to the root `v-app` component by default.

z-bottom-sheet/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component.

z-bottom-sheet/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

z-bottom-sheet/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. This will default the components color to _white_ unless you've configured your [application theme](/customization/theme) to **dark** or if you are using the **color** prop on the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-bottom-sheet/disabled.description: Disables the ability to open the component.

z-bottom-sheet/eager.description: Will force the components content to render on mounted. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

z-bottom-sheet/hide-overlay.description: Hides the display of the overlay.

z-bottom-sheet/inset.description: Reduces the sheet content maximum width to 70%.

z-bottom-sheet/internal-activator.description: Detaches the menu content inside of the component as opposed to the document.

z-bottom-sheet/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-bottom-sheet/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-bottom-sheet/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of a `v-dialog`'s content when using the **persistent** prop.

z-bottom-sheet/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component.

z-bottom-sheet/open-on-hover.description: Designates whether component should activate when its activator is hovered.

z-bottom-sheet/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

z-bottom-sheet/persistent.description: Clicking outside of the element or pressing **esc** key will not deactivate it.

z-bottom-sheet/retain-focus.description: Tab focus will return to the first child of the dialog by default. Disable this when using external tools that require focus such as TinyMCE or vue-clipboard.

z-bottom-sheet/scrollable.description: When set to true, expects a `v-card` and a `v-card-text` component with a designated height. For more information, check out the [scrollable example](/components/dialogs#scrollable).

z-bottom-sheet/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in transitions](/styles/transitions) or one your own.

z-bottom-sheet/value.description: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.

z-bottom-sheet/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-breadcrumbs/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-breadcrumbs/divider.description: Specifies the dividing character between items.

z-breadcrumbs/items.description: An array of objects for each breadcrumb.

z-breadcrumbs/large.description: Increase the font-size of the breadcrumb item text to 16px (14px default).

z-breadcrumbs/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-breadcrumbs-item/active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active. You can find more information about the [**active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-breadcrumbs-item/append.description: Setting **append** prop always appends the relative path to the current path. You can find more information about the [**append** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#append) on the vue-router documentation.

z-breadcrumbs-item/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

z-breadcrumbs-item/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

z-breadcrumbs-item/exact-active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active with exact match. You can find more information about the [**exact-active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact-active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-breadcrumbs-item/exact-path.description: Exactly match the link, ignoring the `query` and the `hash` sections. You can find more information about the [**exact-path** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact-path) on the vue-router documentation.

z-breadcrumbs-item/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

z-breadcrumbs-item/link.description: Designates that the component is a link. This is automatic when using the **href** or **to** prop.

z-breadcrumbs-item/nuxt.description: Specifies the link is a `nuxt-link`. For use with the [nuxt framework](https://nuxtjs.org/api/components-nuxt-link/).

z-breadcrumbs-item/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [**replace** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) on the vue-router documentation.

z-breadcrumbs-item/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-breadcrumbs-item/target.description: Designates the target attribute. This should only be applied when using the **href** prop.

z-breadcrumbs-item/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

z-btn/active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active. You can find more information about the [**active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-btn/append.description: Setting **append** prop always appends the relative path to the current path. You can find more information about the [**append** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#append) on the vue-router documentation.

z-btn/block.description: Expands the button to 100% of available space.

z-btn/bottom.description: Aligns the component towards the bottom.

z-btn/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-btn/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-btn/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

z-btn/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

z-btn/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

z-btn/exact-active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active with exact match. You can find more information about the [**exact-active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact-active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-btn/exact-path.description: Exactly match the link, ignoring the `query` and the `hash` sections. You can find more information about the [**exact-path** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact-path) on the vue-router documentation.

z-btn/fab.description: Designates the button as a floating-action-button. Button will become _round_.

z-btn/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

z-btn/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

z-btn/icon.description: Designates the button as icon. Button will become _round_ and applies the **text** prop.

z-btn/left.description: Aligns the component towards the left.

z-btn/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-btn/link.description: Designates that the component is a link. This is automatic when using the **href** or **to** prop.

z-btn/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

z-btn/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-btn/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

z-btn/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

z-btn/nuxt.description: Specifies the link is a `nuxt-link`. For use with the [nuxt framework](https://nuxtjs.org/api/components-nuxt-link/).

z-btn/outlined.description: Makes the background transparent and applies a thin border.

z-btn/plain.description: Removes the default background change applied when hovering over the button.

z-btn/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [**replace** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) on the vue-router documentation.

z-btn/right.description: Aligns the component towards the right.

z-btn/rounded.description: Applies a large border radius on the button.

z-btn/shaped.description: Applies a large border radius on the top left and bottom right of the card.

z-btn/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-btn/target.description: Designates the target attribute. This should only be applied when using the **href** prop.

z-btn/text.description: Makes the background transparent. When using the **color** prop, the color will be applied to the button text instead of the background.

z-btn/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

z-btn/top.description: Aligns the content towards the top.

z-btn/value.description: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.

z-btn/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-btn-toggle/active-class.description: The **active-class** applied to children when they are activated.

z-btn-toggle/background-color.description: Changes the background-color for the component.

z-btn-toggle/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-btn-toggle/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-btn-toggle/dense.description: Reduces the button size and padding.

z-btn-toggle/group.description: Generally used in [v-toolbar](/components/toolbars) and [v-app-bar](/components/app-bars). Removes background color, border and increases space between the buttons

z-btn-toggle/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-btn-toggle/mandatory.description: Forces a value to always be selected (if available).

z-btn-toggle/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

z-btn-toggle/multiple.description: Allow multiple selections. The **value** prop must be an _array_.

z-btn-toggle/shaped.description: Applies a large border radius on the top left and bottom right of the card.

z-btn-toggle/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-btn-toggle/value.description: The designated model value for the component.

z-calendar/categories.description: Specifies what categories to display in the `category` view. This controls the order of the categories as well. If the calendar uses events any categories specified in those events not specified in this value are dynamically rendered in the view unless `category-hide-dynamic` is true.

z-calendar/category-days.description: The number of days to render in the `category` view.

z-calendar/category-for-invalid.description: The category to place events in that have invalid categories. A category is invalid when it is not a string. By default events without a category are not displayed until this value is specified.

z-calendar/category-hide-dynamic.description: Sets whether categories specified in an event should be hidden if it's not defined in `categories`.

z-calendar/category-show-all.description: Set whether the `category` view should show all defined `categories` even if there are no events for a category.

z-calendar/category-text.description: If categories is a list of objects, you can use this to determine what property to print out as the category text on the calendar. You can provide a function to do some logic or just define the prop name. It's similar to item-text on v-select

z-calendar/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-calendar/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-calendar/day-format.description: Formats day of the month string that appears in a day to a specified locale

z-calendar/end.description: The ending date on the calendar (inclusive) in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD`. This may be ignored depending on the `type` of the calendar.

z-calendar/event-category.description: Set property of *event*'s category. Instead of a property a function can be given which takes an event and returns the category.

z-calendar/event-color.description: A background color for all events or a function which accepts an event object passed to the calendar to return a color.

z-calendar/event-height.description: The height of an event in pixels in the `month` view and at the top of the `day` views.

z-calendar/event-more.description: Whether the more 'button' is displayed on a calendar with too many events in a given day. It will say something like '5 more' and when clicked generates a `click:more` event.

z-calendar/event-more-text.description: The text to display in the more 'button' given the number of hidden events.

z-calendar/event-name.description: Set property of *event*'s displayed name, or a function which accepts an event object passed to the calendar as the first argument and a flag signalling whether the name is for a timed event (true) or an event over a day.

z-calendar/event-overlap-mode.description: One of `stack`, `column`, or a custom render function

z-calendar/event-overlap-threshold.description: A value in minutes that's used to determine whether two timed events should be placed in column beside each other or should be treated as slightly overlapping events.

z-calendar/event-text-color.description: A text color for all events or a function which accepts an event object passed to the calendar to return a color.

z-calendar/event-timed.description: If Dates or milliseconds are used as the start or end timestamp of an event, this prop can be a string to a property on the event that is truthy if the event is a timed event or a function which takes the event and returns a truthy value if the event is a timed event.

z-calendar/events.description: An array of event objects with a property for a start timestamp and optionally a name and end timestamp. If an end timestamp is not given, the value of start will be used. If no name is given, you must provide an implementation for the `event` slot.

z-calendar/first-interval.description: The first interval to display in the `day` view. If `intervalMinutes` is set to 60 and this is set to 9 the first time in the view is 9am.

z-calendar/first-time.description: The first time to display in the `day` view. If specified, this overwrites any `firstInterval` value specified. This can be the number of minutes since midnight, a string in the format of `HH:mm`, or an object with number properties hour and minute.

z-calendar/hide-header.description: If the header at the top of the `day` view should be visible.

z-calendar/interval-count.description: The number of intervals to display in the `day` view.

z-calendar/interval-format.description: Formats time of day string that appears in the interval gutter of the `day` and `week` view to specified locale

z-calendar/interval-height.description: The height of an interval in pixels in the `day` view.

z-calendar/interval-minutes.description: The number of minutes the intervals are in the `day` view. A common interval is 60 minutes so the intervals are an hour.

z-calendar/interval-style.description: Returns CSS styling to apply to the interval.

z-calendar/interval-width.description: The width of the interval gutter on the left side in the `day` view.

z-calendar/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-calendar/locale-first-day-of-year.description: Sets the day that determines the first week of the year, starting with 0 for **Sunday**. For ISO 8601 this should be 4.

z-calendar/max-days.description: The maximum number of days to display in the custom calendar if an `end` day is not set.

z-calendar/min-weeks.description: The minimum number of weeks to display in the `month` or `week` view.

z-calendar/month-format.description: Formats month string that appears in a day to specified locale

z-calendar/now.description: Override the day & time which is considered now. This is in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`. The calendar is styled according to now.

z-calendar/short-intervals.description: If true, the intervals in the `day` view will be 9 AM as opposed to 09:00 AM

z-calendar/short-months.description: Whether the short versions of a month should be used (Jan vs January).

z-calendar/short-weekdays.description: Whether the short versions of a weekday should be used (Mon vs Monday).

z-calendar/show-interval-label.description: Checks if a given day and time should be displayed in the interval gutter of the `day` view.

z-calendar/show-month-on-first.description: Whether the name of the month should be displayed on the first day of the month.

z-calendar/show-week.description: Whether week numbers should be displayed when using the `month` view.

z-calendar/start.description: The starting date on the calendar (inclusive) in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD`. This may be ignored depending on the `type` of the calendar.

z-calendar/type.description: A string which is one of `month`, `week`, `day`, `4day`, `custom-weekly`, `custom-daily`, and `category`. The custom types look at the `start` and `end` dates passed to the component as opposed to the `value`.

z-calendar/value.description: A date in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD` which determines what span of time for the calendar.

z-calendar/weekday-format.description: Formats day of the week string that appears in the header to specified locale

z-calendar/weekdays.description: Specifies which days of the week to display. To display Monday through Friday only, a value of `[1, 2, 3, 4, 5]` can be used. To display a week starting on Monday a value of `[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 0]` can be used.

z-calendar-category/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-calendar-category/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-calendar-category/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-calendar-daily/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-card/active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active. You can find more information about the [**active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-card/append.description: Setting **append** prop always appends the relative path to the current path. You can find more information about the [**append** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#append) on the vue-router documentation.

z-card/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-card/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-card/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

z-card/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

z-card/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

z-card/exact-active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active with exact match. You can find more information about the [**exact-active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact-active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-card/exact-path.description: Exactly match the link, ignoring the `query` and the `hash` sections. You can find more information about the [**exact-path** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact-path) on the vue-router documentation.

z-card/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

z-card/hover.description: Will apply an elevation of 4dp when hovered (default 2dp). You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

z-card/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

z-card/img.description: Specifies an image background for the card. For more advanced implementations, it is recommended that you use the [v-img](/components/images) component. You can find a [v-img example here](/components/cards/#media-with-text).

z-card/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-card/link.description: Designates that the component is a link. This is automatic when using the **href** or **to** prop.

z-card/loader-height.description: Specifies the height of the loader

z-card/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color

z-card/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

z-card/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-card/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

z-card/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

z-card/nuxt.description: Specifies the link is a `nuxt-link`. For use with the [nuxt framework](https://nuxtjs.org/api/components-nuxt-link/).

z-card/outlined.description: Removes elevation (box-shadow) and adds a *thin* border.

z-card/raised.description: Specifies a higher default elevation (8dp). You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

z-card/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [**replace** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) on the vue-router documentation.

z-card/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

z-card/shaped.description: Applies a large border radius on the top left and bottom right of the card.

z-card/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-card/target.description: Designates the target attribute. This should only be applied when using the **href** prop.

z-card/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

z-card/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-carousel/active-class.description: The **active-class** applied to children when they are activated.

z-carousel/continuous.description: If `true`, window will "wrap around" from the last item to the first, and from the first item to the last

z-carousel/cycle.description: Determines if the carousel should cycle through images.

z-carousel/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-carousel/height.description: Sets the height for the component

z-carousel/interval.description: The duration between image cycles. Requires the **cycle** prop.

z-carousel/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-carousel/mandatory.description: Forces a value to always be selected (if available).

z-carousel/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

z-carousel/multiple.description: Allow multiple selections. The **value** prop must be an _array_.

z-carousel/next-icon.description: Icon used for the "next" button if `show-arrows` is `true`

z-carousel/prev-icon.description: Icon used for the "prev" button if `show-arrows` is `true`

z-carousel/progress.description: Displays a carousel progress bar. Requires the **cycle** prop and **interval**.

z-carousel/progress-color.description: Applies specified color to progress bar.

z-carousel/show-arrows-on-hover.description: Display the "next" and "prev" buttons on hover. `show-arrows` MUST ALSO be set.

z-carousel/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-carousel/touch.description: Provide a custom **left** and **right** function when swiped left or right.

z-carousel/value.description: The designated model value for the component.

z-carousel/vertical.description: Uses a vertical transition when changing windows.

z-carousel-item/active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active. You can find more information about the [**active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-carousel-item/append.description: Setting **append** prop always appends the relative path to the current path. You can find more information about the [**append** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#append) on the vue-router documentation.

z-carousel-item/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

z-carousel-item/eager.description: Will force the components content to render on mounted. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

z-carousel-item/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

z-carousel-item/exact-active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active with exact match. You can find more information about the [**exact-active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact-active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-carousel-item/exact-path.description: Exactly match the link, ignoring the `query` and the `hash` sections. You can find more information about the [**exact-path** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact-path) on the vue-router documentation.

z-carousel-item/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

z-carousel-item/link.description: Designates that the component is a link. This is automatic when using the **href** or **to** prop.

z-carousel-item/nuxt.description: Specifies the link is a `nuxt-link`. For use with the [nuxt framework](https://nuxtjs.org/api/components-nuxt-link/).

z-carousel-item/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [**replace** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) on the vue-router documentation.

z-carousel-item/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-carousel-item/target.description: Designates the target attribute. This should only be applied when using the **href** prop.

z-carousel-item/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

z-carousel-item/transition.description: The transition used when the component progressing through items. Can be one of the [built in transitions](/styles/transitions) or one your own.

z-carousel-item/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, the index will be used.

z-checkbox/append-icon.description: Appends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-checkbox/background-color.description: Changes the background-color of the input

z-checkbox/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-checkbox/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. This will default the components color to _white_ unless you've configured your [application theme](/customization/theme) to **dark** or if you are using the **color** prop on the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-checkbox/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state

z-checkbox/error-count.description: The total number of errors that should display at once

z-checkbox/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation

z-checkbox/height.description: Sets the height of the input

z-checkbox/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display

z-checkbox/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component

z-checkbox/indeterminate.description: Sets an indeterminate state for the checkbox

z-checkbox/indeterminate-icon.description: The icon used when in an indeterminate state

z-checkbox/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-checkbox/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color

z-checkbox/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or message if using a string

z-checkbox/multiple.description: Changes expected model to an array

z-checkbox/persistent-hint.description: Forces hint to always be visible

z-checkbox/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-checkbox/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`

z-checkbox/success.description: Puts the input in a manual success state

z-checkbox/success-messages.description: Puts the input in a success state and passes through custom success messages.

z-checkbox/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom value comparator function

z-simple-checkbox/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-simple-checkbox/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-simple-checkbox/indeterminate.description: Sets an indeterminate state for the simple checkbox.

z-simple-checkbox/indeterminate-icon.description: The icon used when in an indeterminate state.

z-simple-checkbox/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-simple-checkbox/value.description: A boolean value that represents whether the simple checkbox is checked.

z-chip/active.description: Determines whether the chip is visible or not.

z-chip/active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active. You can find more information about the [**active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-chip/append.description: Setting **append** prop always appends the relative path to the current path. You can find more information about the [**append** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#append) on the vue-router documentation.

z-chip/close-icon.description: Change the default icon used for **close** chips

z-chip/close-label.description: Text used for *aria-label* on the close button in **close** chips. Can also be customized globally in [Internationalization](/customization/internationalization).

z-chip/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-chip/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-chip/disabled.description: Disables the chip, making it un-selectable

z-chip/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

z-chip/exact-active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active with exact match. You can find more information about the [**exact-active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact-active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-chip/exact-path.description: Exactly match the link, ignoring the `query` and the `hash` sections. You can find more information about the [**exact-path** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact-path) on the vue-router documentation.

z-chip/filter.description: Displays a selection icon when selected

z-chip/filter-icon.description: Change the default icon used for **filter** chips

z-chip/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

z-chip/input-value.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

z-chip/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-chip/link.description: Explicitly define the chip as a link

z-chip/nuxt.description: Specifies the link is a `nuxt-link`. For use with the [nuxt framework](https://nuxtjs.org/api/components-nuxt-link/).

z-chip/outlined.description: Removes background and applies border and text color

z-chip/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [**replace** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) on the vue-router documentation.

z-chip/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-chip/target.description: Designates the target attribute. This should only be applied when using the **href** prop.

z-chip/text-color.description: Applies a specified color to the control text

z-chip/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

z-chip/value.description: The value used when a child of a [v-chip-group](/components/chip-groups).

z-chip-group/active-class.description: The **active-class** applied to children when they are activated.

z-chip-group/center-active.description: Forces the selected chip to be centered

z-chip-group/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-chip-group/column.description: Remove horizontal pagination and wrap items as needed

z-chip-group/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-chip-group/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-chip-group/mandatory.description: Forces a value to always be selected (if available).

z-chip-group/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

z-chip-group/mobile-breakpoint.description: Sets the designated mobile breakpoint for the component.

z-chip-group/multiple.description: Allow multiple selections. The **value** prop must be an _array_.

z-chip-group/next-icon.description: Specify the icon to use for the next icon

z-chip-group/prev-icon.description: Specify the icon to use for the prev icon

z-chip-group/show-arrows.description: Force the display of the pagination arrows

z-chip-group/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-chip-group/value.description: The designated model value for the component.

z-color-picker/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-color-picker/dot-size.description: Changes the size of the selection dot on the canvas

z-color-picker/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

z-color-picker/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-color-picker/mode.description: Sets mode of inputs. Available modes are 'rgba', 'hsla', and 'hexa'. Can be synced with the `.sync` modifier.

z-color-picker/swatches.description: Sets the available color swatches to select from - This prop only accepts rgba hex strings

z-color-picker/swatches-max-height.description: Sets the maximum height of the swatches section

z-color-picker/value.description: Current color. This can be either a string representing a hex color, or an object representing a RGBA, HSLA, or HSVA value

z-color-picker/width.description: Sets the width of the color picker

z-content/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-combobox/allow-overflow.description: Allow the menu to overflow off the screen

z-combobox/append-icon.description: Appends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-combobox/append-outer-icon.description: Appends an icon to the outside the component's input, uses same syntax as `v-icon`

z-combobox/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element that this component should detach to. String can be any valid querySelector and Object can be any valid Node. This will attach to the root `v-app` component by default.

z-combobox/auto-select-first.description: When searching, will always highlight the first option

z-combobox/background-color.description: Changes the background-color of the input

z-combobox/cache-items.description: Keeps a local _unique_ copy of all items that have been passed through the **items** prop.

z-combobox/chips.description: Changes display of selections to chips

z-combobox/clear-icon.description: Applied when using **clearable** and the input is dirty

z-combobox/clearable.description: Add input clear functionality, default icon is Material Design Icons **mdi-clear**

z-combobox/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-combobox/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

z-combobox/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. This will default the components color to _white_ unless you've configured your [application theme](/customization/theme) to **dark** or if you are using the **color** prop on the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-combobox/deletable-chips.description: Adds a remove icon to selected chips

z-combobox/delimiters.description: Accepts an array of strings that will trigger a new tag when typing. Does not replace the normal Tab and Enter keys.

z-combobox/eager.description: Will force the components content to render on mounted. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

z-combobox/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state

z-combobox/error-count.description: The total number of errors that should display at once

z-combobox/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation

z-combobox/filled.description: Applies the alternate filled input style

z-combobox/filter.description: The filtering algorithm used when searching. [example](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/blob/master/packages/vuetify/src/components/VAutocomplete/VAutocomplete.ts#L40)

z-combobox/flat.description: Removes elevation (shadow) added to element when using the **solo** or **solo-inverted** props

z-combobox/height.description: Sets the height of the input

z-combobox/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display

z-combobox/hide-no-data.description: Hides the menu when there are no options to show.  Useful for preventing the menu from opening before results are fetched asynchronously.  Also has the effect of opening the menu when the `items` array changes if not already open.

z-combobox/hide-selected.description: Do not display in the select menu items that are already selected

z-combobox/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component

z-combobox/item-value.description: Set property of **items**'s value - **must be primitive**. Dot notation is supported. **Note:** This is currently not supported with `v-combobox` [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/issues/5479)

z-combobox/items.description: Can be an array of objects or array of strings. When using objects, will look for a text, value and disabled keys. This can be changed using the **item-text**, **item-value** and **item-disabled** props.  Objects that have a **header** or **divider** property are considered special cases and generate a list header or divider; these items are not selectable.

z-combobox/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-combobox/loader-height.description: Specifies the height of the loader

z-combobox/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color

z-combobox/menu-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-menu` component. Accepts either a string for boolean props `menu-props="auto, overflowY"`, or an object `:menu-props="{ auto: true, overflowY: true }"`

z-combobox/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or message if using a string

z-combobox/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value

z-combobox/no-data-text.description: Display text when there is no data

z-combobox/no-filter.description: Do not apply filtering when searching. Useful when data is being filtered server side

z-combobox/open-on-clear.description: When using the **clearable** prop, once cleared, the select menu will either open or stay open, depending on the current state

z-combobox/outlined.description: Applies the outlined style to the input

z-combobox/persistent-hint.description: Forces hint to always be visible

z-combobox/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible

z-combobox/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-combobox/prepend-inner-icon.description: Prepends an icon inside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-combobox/return-object.description: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**

z-combobox/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input

z-combobox/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`

z-combobox/search-input.description: Search value. Can be used with `.sync` modifier.

z-combobox/shaped.description: Round if `outlined` and increase `border-radius` if `filled`. Must be used with either `outlined` or `filled`

z-combobox/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty

z-combobox/small-chips.description: Changes display of selections to chips with the **small** property

z-combobox/solo.description: Changes the style of the input

z-combobox/success.description: Puts the input in a manual success state

z-combobox/success-messages.description: Puts the input in a success state and passes through custom success messages.

z-combobox/value-comparator.description: The comparison algorithm used for values. [More info](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/blob/master/packages/vuetify/src/util/helpers.ts)

z-counter/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-counter/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-data-iterator/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-data-iterator/expanded.description: Array of expanded items. Can be used with `.sync` modifier

z-data-iterator/footer-props.description: See the [`v-data-footer`](/api/v-data-footer) API for more information

z-data-iterator/group-by.description: Changes which item property should be used for grouping items. Currently only supports a single grouping in the format: `group` or `['group']`. When using an array, only the first element is considered. Can be used with `.sync` modifier

z-data-iterator/group-desc.description: Changes which direction grouping is done. Can be used with `.sync` modifier

z-data-iterator/item-key.description: The property on each item that is used as a unique key

z-data-iterator/items.description: The array of items to display

z-data-iterator/items-per-page.description: Changes how many items per page should be visible. Can be used with `.sync` modifier. Setting this prop to `-1` will display all items on the page

z-data-iterator/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-data-iterator/loading.description: If `true` and no items are provided, then a loading text will be shown

z-data-iterator/loading-text.description: Text shown when `loading` is true and no items are provided

z-data-iterator/locale.description: Sets the locale used for sorting. This is passed into [`Intl.Collator()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl/Collator/Collator) in the default `customSort` function

z-data-iterator/mobile-breakpoint.description: Used to set when to toggle between regular table and mobile view

z-data-iterator/multi-sort.description: If `true` then one can sort on multiple properties

z-data-iterator/must-sort.description: If `true` then one can not disable sorting, it will always switch between ascending and descending

z-data-iterator/no-data-text.description: Text shown when no items are provided to the component

z-data-iterator/no-results-text.description: Text shown when `search` prop is used and there are no results

z-data-iterator/search.description: Text input used to filter items

z-data-iterator/selectable-key.description: The property on each item that is used to determine if it is selectable or not

z-data-iterator/server-items-length.description: Used only when data is provided by a server. Should be set to the total amount of items available on server so that pagination works correctly

z-data-iterator/single-expand.description: Changes expansion mode to single expand

z-data-iterator/single-select.description: Changes selection mode to single select

z-data-iterator/sort-by.description: Changes which item property (or properties) should be used for sort order. Can be used with `.sync` modifier

z-data-iterator/sort-desc.description: Changes which direction sorting is done. Can be used with `.sync` modifier

z-data-footer/items-per-page-all-text.description: Text for 'All' option in items-per-page dropdown

z-data-footer/items-per-page-options.description: Array of options to show in the items-per-page dropdown

z-data-footer/show-current-page.description: Show current page number between prev/next icons

z-data-table/checkbox-color.description: Set the color of the checkboxes (showSelect must be used)

z-data-table/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-data-table/expand-icon.description: Icon used for expand toggle button.

z-data-table/expanded.description: Array of expanded items. Can be used with `.sync` modifier

z-data-table/fixed-header.description: Fixed header to top of table. **NOTE:** Does not work in IE11

z-data-table/footer-props.description: See the [`v-data-footer`](/api/v-data-footer) API for more information

z-data-table/height.description: Set an explicit height of table
