z-data-table/item-key.description: The property on each item that is used as a unique key

z-data-table/items.description: The array of items to display

z-data-table/items-per-page.description: Changes how many items per page should be visible. Can be used with `.sync` modifier. Setting this prop to `-1` will display all items on the page

z-data-table/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-data-table/loader-height.description: Specifies the height of the loader

z-data-table/loading.description: If `true` and no items are provided, then a loading text will be shown

z-data-table/loading-text.description: Text shown when `loading` is true and no items are provided

z-data-table/locale.description: Sets the locale used for sorting. This is passed into [`Intl.Collator()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl/Collator/Collator) in the default `customSort` function

z-data-table/mobile-breakpoint.description: Used to set when to toggle between regular table and mobile view

z-data-table/multi-sort.description: If `true` then one can sort on multiple properties

z-data-table/must-sort.description: If `true` then one can not disable sorting, it will always switch between ascending and descending

z-data-table/no-data-text.description: Text shown when no items are provided to the component

z-data-table/no-results-text.description: Text shown when `search` prop is used and there are no results

z-data-table/search.description: Text input used to filter items

z-data-table/selectable-key.description: The property on each item that is used to determine if it is selectable or not

z-data-table/server-items-length.description: Used only when data is provided by a server. Should be set to the total amount of items available on server so that pagination works correctly

z-data-table/show-expand.description: Shows the expand toggle in default rows

z-data-table/show-group-by.description: Shows the group by toggle in the header and enables grouped rows

z-data-table/show-select.description: Shows the select checkboxes in both the header and rows (if using default rows)

z-data-table/single-expand.description: Changes expansion mode to single expand

z-data-table/single-select.description: Changes selection mode to single select

z-data-table/sort-by.description: Changes which item property (or properties) should be used for sort order. Can be used with `.sync` modifier

z-data-table/sort-desc.description: Changes which direction sorting is done. Can be used with `.sync` modifier

z-data-table-header/every-item.description: Indicates if all items in table are selected

z-data-table-header/headers.description: Array of header items to display

z-data-table-header/options.description: Options object. Identical to the one on `v-data-table`

z-data-table-header/some-items.description: Indicates if one or more items in table are selected

z-edit-dialog/cancel-text.description: Sets the default text for the cancel button when using the **large** prop

z-edit-dialog/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-edit-dialog/eager.description: Will force the components content to render on mounted. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

z-edit-dialog/large.description: Attaches a submit and cancel button to the dialog

z-edit-dialog/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-edit-dialog/persistent.description: Clicking outside or pressing **esc** key will not dismiss the dialog

z-edit-dialog/save-text.description: Sets the default text for the save button when using the **large** prop

z-edit-dialog/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in transitions](/styles/transitions) or one your own.

z-simple-table/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-simple-table/dense.description: Decreases paddings to render a dense table

z-simple-table/fixed-header.description: Sets table header to fixed mode

z-simple-table/height.description: Sets the height for the component

z-simple-table/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-virtual-table/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-virtual-table/dense.description: Decreases paddings to render a dense table

z-virtual-table/fixed-header.description: Sets table header to fixed mode

z-virtual-table/height.description: Sets the height for the component

z-virtual-table/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-date-picker/active-picker.description: Determines which picker in the date or month picker is being displayed. Allowed values: `'DATE'`, `'MONTH'`, `'YEAR'`

z-date-picker/allowed-dates.description: Restricts which dates can be selected

z-date-picker/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-date-picker/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-date-picker/day-format.description: Allows you to customize the format of the day string that appears in the date table. Called with date (ISO 8601 **date** string) arguments.

z-date-picker/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

z-date-picker/event-color.description: Sets the color for event dot. It can be string (all events will have the same color) or `object` where attribute is the event date and value is boolean/color/array of colors for specified date or `function` taking date as a parameter and returning boolean/color/array of colors for that date

z-date-picker/events.description: Array of dates or object defining events or colors or function returning boolean/color/array of colors

z-date-picker/first-day-of-week.description: Sets the first day of the week, starting with 0 for Sunday.

z-date-picker/header-color.description: Defines the header color. If not specified it will use the color defined by color prop or the default picker color

z-date-picker/header-date-format.description: Allows you to customize the format of the month string that appears in the header of the calendar. Called with date (ISO 8601 **date** string) arguments.

z-date-picker/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-date-picker/locale.description: Sets the locale. Accepts a string with a BCP 47 language tag.

z-date-picker/locale-first-day-of-year.description: Sets the day that determines the first week of the year, starting with 0 for **Sunday**. For ISO 8601 this should be 4.

z-date-picker/month-format.description: Formatting function used for displaying months in the months table. Called with date (ISO 8601 **date** string) arguments.

z-date-picker/multiple.description: Allow the selection of multiple dates

z-date-picker/next-icon.description: Sets the icon for next month/year button

z-date-picker/prev-icon.description: Sets the icon for previous month/year button

z-date-picker/range.description: Allow the selection of date range

z-date-picker/reactive.description: Updates the picker model when changing months/years automatically

z-date-picker/readonly.description: Makes the picker readonly (doesn't allow to select new date)

z-date-picker/scrollable.description: Allows changing displayed month with mouse scroll

z-date-picker/selected-items-text.description: Text used for translating the number of selected dates when using *multiple* prop. Can also be customizing globally in [Internationalization](/customization/internationalization).

z-date-picker/show-adjacent-months.description: Toggles visibility of days from previous and next months

z-date-picker/show-current.description: Toggles visibility of the current date/month outline or shows the provided date/month as a current

z-date-picker/show-week.description: Toggles visibility of the week numbers in the body of the calendar

z-date-picker/title-date-format.description: Allows you to customize the format of the date string that appears in the title of the date picker. Called with date (ISO 8601 **date** string) arguments.

z-date-picker/type.description: Determines the type of the picker - `date` for date picker, `month` for month picker

z-date-picker/value.description: Date picker model (ISO 8601 format, YYYY-mm-dd or YYYY-mm)

z-date-picker/weekday-format.description: Allows you to customize the format of the weekday string that appears in the body of the calendar. Called with date (ISO 8601 **date** string) arguments.

z-date-picker/year-format.description: Allows you to customize the format of the year string that appears in the header of the calendar. Called with date (ISO 8601 **date** string) arguments.

z-date-picker/year-icon.description: Sets the icon in the year selection button

z-date-picker-title/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-date-picker-header/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-date-picker-header/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-date-picker-header/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-date-picker-date-table/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-date-picker-date-table/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-date-picker-date-table/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-date-picker-month-table/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-date-picker-month-table/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-date-picker-month-table/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-date-picker-years/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-dialog/activator.description: Designate a custom activator when the `activator` slot is not used. String can be any valid querySelector and Object can be any valid Node.

z-dialog/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element that this component should detach to. String can be any valid querySelector and Object can be any valid Node. This will attach to the root `v-app` component by default.

z-dialog/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component.

z-dialog/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

z-dialog/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. This will default the components color to _white_ unless you've configured your [application theme](/customization/theme) to **dark** or if you are using the **color** prop on the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-dialog/disabled.description: Disables the ability to open the component.

z-dialog/eager.description: Will force the components content to render on mounted. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

z-dialog/hide-overlay.description: Hides the display of the overlay.

z-dialog/internal-activator.description: Detaches the menu content inside of the component as opposed to the document.

z-dialog/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-dialog/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-dialog/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of a `v-dialog`'s content when using the **persistent** prop.

z-dialog/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component.

z-dialog/open-on-hover.description: Designates whether component should activate when its activator is hovered.

z-dialog/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

z-dialog/persistent.description: Clicking outside of the element or pressing **esc** key will not deactivate it.

z-dialog/retain-focus.description: Tab focus will return to the first child of the dialog by default. Disable this when using external tools that require focus such as TinyMCE or vue-clipboard.

z-dialog/scrollable.description: When set to true, expects a `v-card` and a `v-card-text` component with a designated height. For more information, check out the [scrollable example](/components/dialogs#scrollable).

z-dialog/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in transitions](/styles/transitions) or one your own.

z-dialog/value.description: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.

z-dialog/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-divider/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-divider/inset.description: Adds indentation (72px) for **normal** dividers, reduces max height for **vertical**.

z-divider/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-expansion-panels/accordion.description: Removes the margin around open panels

z-expansion-panels/active-class.description: The **active-class** applied to children when they are activated.

z-expansion-panels/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-expansion-panels/flat.description: Removes the expansion-panel's elevation and borders

z-expansion-panels/hover.description: Applies a background-color shift on hover to expansion panel headers

z-expansion-panels/inset.description: Makes the expansion-panel open with a inset style

z-expansion-panels/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-expansion-panels/mandatory.description: Forces a value to always be selected (if available).

z-expansion-panels/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

z-expansion-panels/multiple.description: Allow multiple selections. The **value** prop must be an _array_.

z-expansion-panels/popout.description: Makes the expansion-panel open with an popout style

z-expansion-panels/readonly.description: Makes the entire expansion-panel read only.

z-expansion-panels/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-expansion-panels/value.description: Controls the opened/closed state of content in the expansion-panel. Corresponds to a zero-based index of the currently opened content. If the `multiple` prop (previously `expand` in 1.5.x) is used then it is an array of numbers where each entry corresponds to the index of the opened content.  The index order is not relevant.

z-expansion-panel/active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active. You can find more information about the [**active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-expansion-panel/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

z-expansion-panel/readonly.description: Makes the expansion-panel content read only.

z-expansion-panel-header/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-expansion-panel-header/disable-icon-ro.description: Removes the icon rotation animation when expanding a panel

z-expansion-panel-header/hide-actions.description: Hide the expand icon in the content header

z-expansion-panel-content/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-expansion-panel-content/eager.description: Will force the components content to render on mounted. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

z-file-input/append-icon.description: Appends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-file-input/append-outer-icon.description: Appends an icon to the outside the component's input, uses same syntax as `v-icon`

z-file-input/background-color.description: Changes the background-color of the input

z-file-input/chips.description: Changes display of selections to chips

z-file-input/clear-icon.description: Applied when using **clearable** and the input is dirty

z-file-input/clearable.description: Add input clear functionality, default icon is Material Design Icons **mdi-clear**

z-file-input/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-file-input/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

z-file-input/counter-size-string.description: The text displayed when using the **counter** and **show-size** props. Can also be customized globally on the [internationalization page](/customization/internationalization).

z-file-input/counter-string.description: The text displayed when using the **counter** prop. Can also be customized globally on the [internationalization page](/customization/internationalization).

z-file-input/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. This will default the components color to _white_ unless you've configured your [application theme](/customization/theme) to **dark** or if you are using the **color** prop on the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-file-input/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state

z-file-input/error-count.description: The total number of errors that should display at once

z-file-input/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation

z-file-input/filled.description: Applies the alternate filled input style

z-file-input/flat.description: Removes elevation (shadow) added to element when using the **solo** or **solo-inverted** props

z-file-input/height.description: Sets the height of the input

z-file-input/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display

z-file-input/hide-input.description: Display the icon only without the input (file names)

z-file-input/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component

z-file-input/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-file-input/loader-height.description: Specifies the height of the loader

z-file-input/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color

z-file-input/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or message if using a string

z-file-input/multiple.description: Adds the **multiple** attribute to the input, allowing multiple file selections.

z-file-input/outlined.description: Applies the outlined style to the input

z-file-input/persistent-hint.description: Forces hint to always be visible

z-file-input/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible

z-file-input/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-file-input/prepend-inner-icon.description: Prepends an icon inside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-file-input/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input

z-file-input/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`

z-file-input/shaped.description: Round if `outlined` and increase `border-radius` if `filled`. Must be used with either `outlined` or `filled`

z-file-input/show-size.description: Sets the displayed size of selected file(s). When using **true** will default to _1000_ displaying (**kB, MB, GB**) while _1024_ will display (**KiB, MiB, GiB**).

z-file-input/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty

z-file-input/small-chips.description: Changes display of selections to chips with the **small** property

z-file-input/solo.description: Changes the style of the input

z-file-input/success.description: Puts the input in a manual success state

z-file-input/success-messages.description: Puts the input in a success state and passes through custom success messages.

z-file-input/truncate-length.description: The length of a filename before it is truncated with ellipsis

z-footer/app.description: Designates the component as part of the application layout. Used for dynamically adjusting content sizing. Components using this prop should reside **outside** of `v-main` component to function properly. You can find more information about layouts on the [application page](/components/application). **Note:** this prop automatically applies **position: fixed** to the layout element. You can overwrite this functionality by using the `absolute` prop

z-footer/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-footer/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-footer/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

z-footer/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

z-footer/inset.description: Positions the toolbar offset from an application `v-navigation-drawer`

z-footer/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-footer/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

z-footer/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-footer/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

z-footer/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

z-footer/outlined.description: Removes elevation (box-shadow) and adds a *thin* border.

z-footer/padless.description: Remove all padding from the footer

z-footer/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

z-footer/shaped.description: Applies a large border radius on the top left and bottom right of the card.

z-footer/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-footer/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-form/disabled.description: Puts all children inputs into a disabled state.

z-form/lazy-validation.description: If enabled, **value** will always be _true_ unless there are visible validation errors. You can still call `validate()` to manually trigger validation

z-form/readonly.description: Puts all children inputs into a readonly state.

z-form/value.description: A boolean value representing the validity of the form.

z-container/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component

z-container/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-col/align-self.description: Applies the [align-items](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-items) css property. Available options are **start**, **center**, **end**, **auto**, **baseline** and **stretch**.

z-col/cols.description: Sets the default number of columns the component extends. Available options are **1 -> 12** and **auto**.

z-col/lg.description: Changes the number of columns on large and greater breakpoints.

z-col/md.description: Changes the number of columns on medium and greater breakpoints.

z-col/offset.description: Sets the default offset for the column.

z-col/offset-lg.description: Changes the offset of the component on large and greater breakpoints.

z-col/offset-md.description: Changes the offset of the component on medium and greater breakpoints.

z-col/offset-sm.description: Changes the offset of the component on small and greater breakpoints.

z-col/offset-xl.description: Changes the offset of the component on extra large and greater breakpoints.

z-col/order.description: Sets the default [order](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/order) for the column.

z-col/order-lg.description: Changes the order of the component on large and greater breakpoints.

z-col/order-md.description: Changes the order of the component on medium and greater breakpoints.

z-col/order-sm.description: Changes the order of the component on small and greater breakpoints.

z-col/order-xl.description: Changes the order of the component on extra large and greater breakpoints.

z-col/sm.description: Changes the number of columns on small and greater breakpoints.

z-col/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-col/xl.description: Changes the number of columns on extra large and greater breakpoints.

z-row/align.description: Applies the [align-items](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-items) css property. Available options are **start**, **center**, **end**, **baseline** and **stretch**.

z-row/align-content.description: Applies the [align-content](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-content) css property. Available options are **start**, **center**, **end**, **space-between**, **space-around** and **stretch**.

z-row/align-content-lg.description: Changes the **align-content** property on large and greater breakpoints.

z-row/align-content-md.description: Changes the **align-content** property on medium and greater breakpoints.

z-row/align-content-sm.description: Changes the **align-content** property on small and greater breakpoints.

z-row/align-content-xl.description: Changes the **align-content** property on extra large and greater breakpoints.

z-row/align-lg.description: Changes the **align-items** property on large and greater breakpoints.

z-row/align-md.description: Changes the **align-items** property on medium and greater breakpoints.

z-row/align-sm.description: Changes the **align-items** property on small and greater breakpoints.

z-row/align-xl.description: Changes the **align-items** property on extra large and greater breakpoints.

z-row/justify.description: Applies the [justify-content](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/justify-content) css property. Available options are **start**, **center**, **end**, **space-between** and **space-around**.

z-row/justify-lg.description: Changes the **justify-content** property on large and greater breakpoints.

z-row/justify-md.description: Changes the **justify-content** property on medium and greater breakpoints.

z-row/justify-sm.description: Changes the **justify-content** property on small and greater breakpoints.

z-row/justify-xl.description: Changes the **justify-content** property on extra large and greater breakpoints.

z-row/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-layout/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component

z-layout/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-flex/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component

z-flex/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-hover/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component.

z-hover/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component.

z-hover/value.description: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.

z-icon/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-icon/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-icon/left.description: Applies appropriate margins to the icon inside of a button when placed to the **left** of another element or text

z-icon/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-icon/right.description: Applies appropriate margins to the icon inside of a button when placed to the **right** of another element or text

z-icon/size.description: Specifies a custom font size for the icon

z-icon/tag.description: Specifies a custom tag to be used

z-img/alt.description: Alternate text for screen readers. Leave empty for decorative images

z-img/aspect-ratio.description: Calculated as `width/height`, so for a 1920x1080px image this will be `1.7778`. Will be calculated automatically if omitted

z-img/contain.description: Prevents the image from being cropped if it doesn't fit

z-img/content-class.description: Apply a custom class to the responsive content div.

z-img/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-img/eager.description: Will force the components content to render on mounted. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

z-img/gradient.description: Overlays a gradient onto the image. Only supports [linear-gradient](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/linear-gradient) syntax, anything else should be done with classes (see examples)

z-img/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

z-img/lazy-src.description:
Something to show while waiting for the main image to load, typically a small base64-encoded thumbnail. Has a slight blur filter applied.

Use [vuetify-loader](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify-loader) to generate automatically

z-img/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-img/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

z-img/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-img/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

z-img/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

z-img/options.description: Options that are passed to the [Intersection observer](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Intersection_Observer_API) constructor.

z-img/position.description: Overrides the default to change which parts get cropped off. Uses the same syntax as [`background-position`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-position)

z-img/src.description: The image URL. This prop is mandatory

z-img/srcset.description: A set of alternate images to use based on device size. [Read more...](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/img#attr-srcset)

z-img/transition.description: The transition to use when switching from `lazy-src` to `src`

z-img/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-input/append-icon.description: Appends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-input/background-color.description: Changes the background-color of the input

z-input/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-input/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. This will default the components color to _white_ unless you've configured your [application theme](/customization/theme) to **dark** or if you are using the **color** prop on the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-input/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state

z-input/error-count.description: The total number of errors that should display at once

z-input/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation

z-input/height.description: Sets the height of the input

z-input/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display

z-input/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component

z-input/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-input/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color

z-input/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or message if using a string

z-input/persistent-hint.description: Forces hint to always be visible

z-input/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-input/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`

z-input/success.description: Puts the input in a manual success state

z-input/success-messages.description: Puts the input in a success state and passes through custom success messages.

z-item/active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active. You can find more information about the [**active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-item/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

z-item/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, the index will be used.

z-item-group/active-class.description: The **active-class** applied to children when they are activated.

z-item-group/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-item-group/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-item-group/mandatory.description: Forces a value to always be selected (if available).

z-item-group/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

z-item-group/multiple.description: Allow multiple selections. The **value** prop must be an _array_.

z-item-group/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-item-group/value.description: The designated model value for the component.

z-label/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-label/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-lazy/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

z-lazy/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

z-lazy/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-lazy/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

z-lazy/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

z-lazy/options.description: Options that are passed to the [Intersection observer](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Intersection_Observer_API) constructor.

z-lazy/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-lazy/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in transitions](/styles/transitions) or one your own.

z-lazy/value.description: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.

z-lazy/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-list/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-list/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-list/dense.description: Lowers max height of list tiles

z-list/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

z-list/expand.description: Will only collapse when explicitly closed

z-list/flat.description: Remove the highlighted background on active `v-list-item`s

z-list/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

z-list/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-list/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

z-list/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-list/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

z-list/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

z-list/nav.description: An alternative styling that reduces `v-list-item` width and rounds the corners. Typically used with **[v-navigation-drawer](/components/navigation-drawers)**

z-list/outlined.description: Removes elevation (box-shadow) and adds a *thin* border.

z-list/shaped.description: Provides an alternative active style for `v-list-item`.

z-list/subheader.description: Removes top padding. Used when previous sibling is a header

z-list/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-list/three-line.description: Increases list-item height for three lines. This prop uses [line-clamp](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/-webkit-line-clamp) and is not supported in all browsers.

z-list/two-line.description: Increases list-item height for two lines. This prop uses [line-clamp](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/-webkit-line-clamp) and is not supported in all browsers.

z-list/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-list-group/active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active. You can find more information about the [**active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-list-group/append-icon.description: Appends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-list-group/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-list-group/eager.description: Will force the components content to render on mounted. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

z-list-group/group.description: Assign a route namespace. Accepts a string or regexp for determining active state

z-list-group/no-action.description: Removes left padding assigned for action icons from group items

z-list-group/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-list-group/sub-group.description: Designate the component as nested list group

z-list-item/active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active. You can find more information about the [**active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-list-item/append.description: Setting **append** prop always appends the relative path to the current path. You can find more information about the [**append** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#append) on the vue-router documentation.

z-list-item/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-list-item/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-list-item/dense.description: Lowers max height of list tiles

z-list-item/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

z-list-item/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

z-list-item/exact-active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active with exact match. You can find more information about the [**exact-active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact-active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-list-item/exact-path.description: Exactly match the link, ignoring the `query` and the `hash` sections. You can find more information about the [**exact-path** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact-path) on the vue-router documentation.

z-list-item/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

z-list-item/inactive.description: If set, the list tile will not be rendered as a link even if it has to/href prop or @click handler

z-list-item/input-value.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component

z-list-item/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-list-item/link.description: Designates that the component is a link. This is automatic when using the **href** or **to** prop.

z-list-item/nuxt.description: Specifies the link is a `nuxt-link`. For use with the [nuxt framework](https://nuxtjs.org/api/components-nuxt-link/).

z-list-item/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [**replace** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) on the vue-router documentation.

z-list-item/selectable.description: Allow text selection inside `v-list-item`. This prop uses [user-select](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/user-select)

z-list-item/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-list-item/target.description: Designates the target attribute. This should only be applied when using the **href** prop.

z-list-item/three-line.description: Increases list-item height for three lines. This prop uses [line-clamp](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/-webkit-line-clamp) and is not supported in all browsers.

z-list-item/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

z-list-item/two-line.description: Increases list-item height for two lines. This prop uses [line-clamp](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/-webkit-line-clamp) and is not supported in all browsers.

z-list-item/value.description: The value used when a child of a [v-list-item-group](/components/list-item-groups).

z-list-item-avatar/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-list-item-avatar/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

z-list-item-avatar/left.description: Designates that the avatar is on the left side of a component. This is hooked into by components such as [v-chip](/components/chips) and [v-btn](/components/buttons).

z-list-item-avatar/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

z-list-item-avatar/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-list-item-avatar/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

z-list-item-avatar/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

z-list-item-avatar/right.description: Designates that the avatar is on the right side of a component. This is hooked into by components such as [v-chip](/components/chips) and [v-btn](/components/buttons).

z-list-item-avatar/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

z-list-item-avatar/size.description: Sets the height and width of the component.

z-list-item-avatar/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-list-item-group/active-class.description: The **active-class** applied to children when they are activated.

z-list-item-group/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-list-item-group/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-list-item-group/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-list-item-group/mandatory.description: Forces a value to always be selected (if available).

z-list-item-group/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

z-list-item-group/multiple.description: Allow multiple selections. The **value** prop must be an _array_.

z-list-item-group/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-list-item-group/value.description: The designated model value for the component.

z-main/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-menu/activator.description: Designate a custom activator when the `activator` slot is not used. String can be any valid querySelector and Object can be any valid Node.

z-menu/allow-overflow.description: Removes overflow re-positioning for the content

z-menu/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element that this component should detach to. String can be any valid querySelector and Object can be any valid Node. This will attach to the root `v-app` component by default.

z-menu/bottom.description: Aligns the component towards the bottom.

z-menu/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only works with the **open-on-hover** prop

z-menu/close-on-click.description: Designates if menu should close on outside-activator click

z-menu/close-on-content-click.description: Designates if menu should close when its content is clicked

z-menu/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

z-menu/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-menu/disabled.description: Disables the ability to open the component.

z-menu/eager.description: Will force the components content to render on mounted. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

z-menu/internal-activator.description: Detaches the menu content inside of the component as opposed to the document.

z-menu/left.description: Aligns the component towards the left.

z-menu/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-menu/max-height.description: Sets the max height of the menu content

z-menu/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the content

z-menu/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the content

z-menu/nudge-bottom.description: Nudge the content to the bottom

z-menu/nudge-left.description: Nudge the content to the left

z-menu/nudge-right.description: Nudge the content to the right

z-menu/nudge-top.description: Nudge the content to the top

z-menu/offset-overflow.description: Causes the component to flip to the opposite side when repositioned due to overflow

z-menu/offset-x.description: Offset the menu on the x-axis. Works in conjunction with direction left/right

z-menu/offset-y.description: Offset the menu on the y-axis. Works in conjunction with direction top/bottom

z-menu/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only works with the **open-on-hover** prop

z-menu/open-on-click.description: Designates whether menu should open on activator click

z-menu/open-on-hover.description: Designates whether menu should open on activator hover

z-menu/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

z-menu/position-x.description: Used to position the content when not using an activator slot

z-menu/position-y.description: Used to position the content when not using an activator slot

z-menu/return-value.description: The value that is updated when the menu is closed - must be primitive. Dot notation is supported

z-menu/right.description: Aligns the component towards the right.

z-menu/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

z-menu/top.description: Aligns the content towards the top.

z-menu/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in transitions](/styles/transitions) or one your own.

z-menu/value.description: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.

z-menu/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component

z-messages/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-messages/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-messages/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-navigation-drawer/app.description: Designates the component as part of the application layout. Used for dynamically adjusting content sizing. Components using this prop should reside **outside** of `v-main` component to function properly. You can find more information about layouts on the [application page](/components/application). **Note:** this prop automatically applies **position: fixed** to the layout element. You can overwrite this functionality by using the `absolute` prop

z-navigation-drawer/bottom.description: Aligns the component towards the bottom.

z-navigation-drawer/clipped.description: A clipped drawer rests under the application toolbar. **Note:** requires the **clipped-left** or **clipped-right** prop on `v-app-bar` to work as intended

z-navigation-drawer/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-navigation-drawer/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-navigation-drawer/disable-resize-watch.description: Will automatically open/close drawer when resized depending if mobile or desktop.

z-navigation-drawer/disable-route-watche.description: Disables opening of navigation drawer when route changes

z-navigation-drawer/expand-on-hover.description: Collapses the drawer to a **mini-variant** until hovering with the mouse

z-navigation-drawer/floating.description: A floating drawer has no visible container (no border-right)

z-navigation-drawer/height.description: Sets the height of the navigation drawer

z-navigation-drawer/hide-overlay.description: Hides the display of the overlay.

z-navigation-drawer/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-navigation-drawer/mini-variant.description: Condenses navigation drawer width, also accepts the **.sync** modifier. With this, the drawer will re-open when clicking it

z-navigation-drawer/mini-variant-width.description: Designates the width assigned when the `mini` prop is turned on

z-navigation-drawer/mobile-breakpoint.description: Sets the designated mobile breakpoint for the component. This will apply alternate styles for mobile devices such as the `temporary` prop, or activate the `bottom` prop when the breakpoint value is met. Setting the value to `0` will disable this functionality.

z-navigation-drawer/permanent.description: The drawer remains visible regardless of screen size

z-navigation-drawer/right.description: Aligns the component towards the right.

z-navigation-drawer/src.description: Specifies a [v-img](/components/images) as the component's background.

z-navigation-drawer/stateless.description: Remove all automated state functionality (resize, mobile, route) and manually control the drawer state

z-navigation-drawer/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-navigation-drawer/temporary.description: A temporary drawer sits above its application and uses a scrim (overlay) to darken the background

z-navigation-drawer/value.description: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.

z-navigation-drawer/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-overflow-btn/allow-overflow.description: Allow the menu to overflow off the screen

z-overflow-btn/append-icon.description: Appends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-overflow-btn/append-outer-icon.description: Appends an icon to the outside the component's input, uses same syntax as `v-icon`

z-overflow-btn/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element that this component should detach to. String can be any valid querySelector and Object can be any valid Node. This will attach to the root `v-app` component by default.

z-overflow-btn/auto-select-first.description: When searching, will always highlight the first option

z-overflow-btn/background-color.description: Changes the background-color of the input

z-overflow-btn/cache-items.description: Keeps a local _unique_ copy of all items that have been passed through the **items** prop.

z-overflow-btn/chips.description: Changes display of selections to chips

z-overflow-btn/clear-icon.description: Applied when using **clearable** and the input is dirty

z-overflow-btn/clearable.description: Add input clear functionality, default icon is Material Design Icons **mdi-clear**

z-overflow-btn/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-overflow-btn/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

z-overflow-btn/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. This will default the components color to _white_ unless you've configured your [application theme](/customization/theme) to **dark** or if you are using the **color** prop on the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-overflow-btn/deletable-chips.description: Adds a remove icon to selected chips

z-overflow-btn/eager.description: Will force the components content to render on mounted. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

z-overflow-btn/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state

z-overflow-btn/error-count.description: The total number of errors that should display at once

z-overflow-btn/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation

z-overflow-btn/filled.description: Applies the alternate filled input style

z-overflow-btn/filter.description: The filtering algorithm used when searching. [example](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/blob/master/packages/vuetify/src/components/VAutocomplete/VAutocomplete.ts#L40)

z-overflow-btn/flat.description: Removes elevation (shadow) added to element when using the **solo** or **solo-inverted** props

z-overflow-btn/height.description: Sets the height of the input

z-overflow-btn/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display

z-overflow-btn/hide-no-data.description: Hides the menu when there are no options to show.  Useful for preventing the menu from opening before results are fetched asynchronously.  Also has the effect of opening the menu when the `items` array changes if not already open.

z-overflow-btn/hide-selected.description: Do not display in the select menu items that are already selected

z-overflow-btn/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component

z-overflow-btn/item-value.description: Set property of **items**'s value - **must be primitive**. Dot notation is supported. **Note:** This is currently not supported with `v-combobox` [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/issues/5479)

z-overflow-btn/items.description: Can be an array of objects or array of strings. When using objects, will look for a text, value and disabled keys. This can be changed using the **item-text**, **item-value** and **item-disabled** props.  Objects that have a **header** or **divider** property are considered special cases and generate a list header or divider; these items are not selectable.

z-overflow-btn/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-overflow-btn/loader-height.description: Specifies the height of the loader

z-overflow-btn/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color

z-overflow-btn/menu-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-menu` component. Accepts either a string for boolean props `menu-props="auto, overflowY"`, or an object `:menu-props="{ auto: true, overflowY: true }"`

z-overflow-btn/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or message if using a string

z-overflow-btn/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value

z-overflow-btn/no-data-text.description: Display text when there is no data

z-overflow-btn/no-filter.description: Do not apply filtering when searching. Useful when data is being filtered server side

z-overflow-btn/open-on-clear.description: When using the **clearable** prop, once cleared, the select menu will either open or stay open, depending on the current state

z-overflow-btn/outlined.description: Applies the outlined style to the input

z-overflow-btn/persistent-hint.description: Forces hint to always be visible

z-overflow-btn/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible

z-overflow-btn/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-overflow-btn/prepend-inner-icon.description: Prepends an icon inside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-overflow-btn/return-object.description: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**

z-overflow-btn/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input

z-overflow-btn/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. z-slide-group/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

z-slide-group/mobile-breakpoint.description: Sets the designated mobile breakpoint for the component.

z-slide-group/multiple.description: Allow multiple selections. The **value** prop must be an _array_.

z-slide-group/next-icon.description: The appended slot when arrows are shown

z-slide-group/prev-icon.description: The prepended slot when arrows are shown

z-slide-group/show-arrows.description: Change when the overflow arrow indicators are shown. By **default**, arrows *always* display on Desktop when the container is overflowing. When the container overflows on mobile, arrows are not shown by default. A **show-arrows** value of `true` allows these arrows to show on Mobile if the container overflowing. A value of `desktop` *always* displays arrows on Desktop while a value of `mobile` always displays arrows on Mobile. A value of `always` always displays arrows on Desktop *and* Mobile. Find more information on how to customize breakpoint thresholds on the [breakpoints page](/customizing/breakpoints).

z-slide-group/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-slide-group/value.description: The designated model value for the component.

z-slide-item/active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active. You can find more information about the [**active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-slide-item/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

z-slide-item/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, the index will be used.

z-snackbar/app.description: Respects boundaries ofand will not overlap withother `app` components like `v-app-bar`, `v-navigation-drawer`, and `v-footer`.

z-snackbar/centered.description: Positions the snackbar in the center of the screen, (x and y axis).

z-snackbar/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-snackbar/content-class.description: Apply a custom class to the snackbar content

z-snackbar/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-snackbar/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

z-snackbar/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

z-snackbar/left.description: Aligns the component towards the left.

z-snackbar/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-snackbar/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

z-snackbar/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-snackbar/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

z-snackbar/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

z-snackbar/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

z-stepper-step/error-icon.description: Icon to display when step has an error

Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`

z-stepper-step/step.description: Content to display inside step circle

z-switch/append-icon.description: Appends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

z-switch/background-color.description: Changes the background-color of the input

z-switch/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-switch/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. This will default the components color to _white_ unless you've configured your [application theme](/customization/theme) to **dark** or if you are using the **color** prop on the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-switch/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state

z-switch/error-count.description: The total number of errors that should display at once

z-switch/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation

z-switch/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display

z-switch/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component

z-switch/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-switch/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or message if using a string

z-switch/multiple.description: Changes expected model to an array

z-switch/persistent-hint.description: Forces hint to always be visible

z-switch/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`

z-system-bar/app.description: Designates the component as part of the application layout. Used for dynamically adjusting content sizing. Components using this prop should reside **outside** of `v-main` component to function properly. You can find more information about layouts on the [application page](/components/application). **Note:** this prop automatically applies **position: fixed** to the layout element. You can overwrite this functionality by using the `absolute` prop

z-tabs/vertical.description: Stacks tabs on top of each other vertically.

z-tab/active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active. You can find more information about the [**active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-tab/append.description: Setting **append** prop always appends the relative path to the current path. You can find more information about the [**append** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#append) on the vue-router documentation.

z-tab/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-tab/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

z-tab/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

z-tab/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [**replace** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) on the vue-router documentation.
