z-text-field/shaped.description: Round if `outlined` and increase `border-radius` if `filled`. Must be used with either `outlined` or `filled`

z-text-field/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty

z-text-field/solo.description: Changes the style of the input

z-text-field/success.description: Puts the input in a manual success state

z-text-field/success-messages.description: Puts the input in a success state and passes through custom success messages.

z-theme-provider/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-theme-provider/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-theme-provider/root.description: Use the current value of `$vuetify.theme.dark` as opposed to the provided one.

z-timeline/align-top.description: Align caret and dot of timeline items to the top

z-timeline/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-timeline/dense.description: Hide opposite slot content, and position all items to one side of timeline

z-timeline/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-timeline-item/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-timeline-item/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-timeline-item/icon-color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-timeline-item/left.description: Explicitly set the item to a left orientation

z-timeline-item/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-timeline-item/right.description: Explicitly set the item to a right orientation

z-time-picker/allowed-hours.description: Restricts which hours can be selected

z-time-picker/allowed-minutes.description: Restricts which minutes can be selected

z-time-picker/allowed-seconds.description: Restricts which seconds can be selected

z-time-picker/ampm-in-title.description: Place AM/PM switch in title, not near the clock.

z-time-picker/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-time-picker/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-time-picker/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

z-time-picker/format.description: Defines the format of a time displayed in picker. Available options are `ampm` and `24hr`.

z-time-picker/header-color.description: Defines the header color. If not specified it will use the color defined by color prop or the default picker color

z-time-picker/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-time-picker/scrollable.description: Allows changing hour/minute with mouse scroll

z-time-picker/use-seconds.description: Toggles the use of seconds in picker

z-time-picker-clock/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-time-picker-clock/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-time-picker-clock/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-time-picker-title/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-toolbar/absolute.description: Applies position: absolute to the component.

z-toolbar/bottom.description: Aligns the component towards the bottom.

z-toolbar/collapse.description: Puts the toolbar into a collapsed state reducing its maximum width.

z-toolbar/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-toolbar/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-toolbar/dense.description: Reduces the height of the toolbar content to 48px (96px when using the **prominent** prop).

z-toolbar/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

z-toolbar/extended.description: Use this prop to increase the height of the toolbar _without_ using the `extension` slot for adding content. May be used in conjunction with the **extension-height** prop, and any of the other props that affect the height of the toolbar, e.g. **prominent**, **dense**, etc., **WITH THE EXCEPTION** of **height**.

z-toolbar/extension-height.description: Specify an explicit height for the `extension` slot.

z-toolbar/height.description: Designates a specific height for the toolbar. Overrides the heights imposed by other props, e.g. **prominent**, **dense**, **extended**, etc.

z-toolbar/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-toolbar/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

z-toolbar/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-toolbar/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

z-toolbar/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

z-toolbar/outlined.description: Removes elevation (box-shadow) and adds a *thin* border.

z-toolbar/prominent.description: Increases the height of the toolbar content to 128px.

z-toolbar/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

z-toolbar/shaped.description: Applies a large border radius on the top left and bottom right of the card.

z-toolbar/short.description: Reduce the height of the toolbar content to 56px (112px when using the **prominent** prop).

z-toolbar/src.description: Specifies a [v-img](/components/images) as the component's background.

z-toolbar/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-toolbar/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-tooltip/activator.description: Designate a custom activator when the `activator` slot is not used. String can be any valid querySelector and Object can be any valid Node.

z-tooltip/allow-overflow.description: Removes overflow re-positioning for the content

z-tooltip/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element that this component should detach to. String can be any valid querySelector and Object can be any valid Node. This will attach to the root `v-app` component by default.

z-tooltip/bottom.description: Aligns the component towards the bottom.

z-tooltip/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component.

z-tooltip/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find list of built in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

z-tooltip/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

z-tooltip/disabled.description: Disables the ability to open the component.

z-tooltip/eager.description: Will force the components content to render on mounted. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

z-tooltip/internal-activator.description: Designates whether to use an internal activator

z-tooltip/left.description: Aligns the component towards the left.

z-tooltip/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the content

z-tooltip/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the content

z-tooltip/nudge-bottom.description: Nudge the content to the bottom

z-tooltip/nudge-left.description: Nudge the content to the left

z-tooltip/nudge-right.description: Nudge the content to the right

z-tooltip/nudge-top.description: Nudge the content to the top

z-tooltip/offset-overflow.description: Causes the component to flip to the opposite side when repositioned due to overflow

z-tooltip/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component.

z-tooltip/open-on-click.description: Designates whether the tooltip should open on activator click

z-tooltip/open-on-hover.description: Designates whether the tooltip should open on activator hover

z-tooltip/position-x.description: Used to position the content when not using an activator slot

z-tooltip/position-y.description: Used to position the content when not using an activator slot

z-tooltip/right.description: Aligns the component towards the right.

z-tooltip/tag.description: Specifies a custom tag for the activator wrapper

z-tooltip/top.description: Aligns the content towards the top.

z-tooltip/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in transitions](/styles/transitions) or one your own.

z-tooltip/value.description: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.

z-tooltip/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component

z-treeview/activatable.description: Allows user to mark a node as active by clicking on it

z-treeview/active.description: Syncable prop that allows one to control which nodes are active. The array consists of the `item-key` of each active item.

z-treeview/active-class.description: The class applied to the node when active

z-treeview/color.description: Sets the color of the active node

z-treeview/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-treeview/dense.description: Decreases the height of the items

z-treeview/expand-icon.description: Icon used to indicate that a node can be expanded

z-treeview/filter.description: Custom item filtering function. By default it will use case-insensitive search in item's label.

z-treeview/hoverable.description: Applies a hover class when mousing over nodes

z-treeview/indeterminate-icon.description: Icon used when node is in an indeterminate state. Only visible when `selectable` is `true`.

z-treeview/item-children.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its children

z-treeview/item-disabled.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains the disabled state of the item

z-treeview/item-key.description: Property on supplied `items` used to keep track of node state. The value of this property has to be unique among all items.

z-treeview/item-text.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its label text

z-treeview/items.description: An array of items used to build the treeview

z-treeview/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-treeview/load-children.description: A function used when dynamically loading children. If this prop is set, then the supplied function will be run if expanding an item that has a `item-children` property that is an empty array. Supports returning a Promise.

z-treeview/loading-icon.description: Icon used when node is in a loading state

z-treeview/multiple-active.description: When `true`, allows user to have multiple active nodes at the same time

z-treeview/off-icon.description: Icon used when node is not selected. Only visible when `selectable` is `true`.

z-treeview/on-icon.description: Icon used when leaf node is selected or when a branch node is fully selected. Only visible when `selectable` is `true`.

z-treeview/open.description: Syncable prop that allows one to control which nodes are open. The array consists of the `item-key` of each open item.

z-treeview/open-all.description: When `true` will cause all branch nodes to be opened when component is mounted

z-treeview/open-on-click.description: When `true` will cause nodes to be opened by clicking anywhere on it, instead of only opening by clicking on expand icon. When using this prop with `activatable` you will be unable to mark nodes with children as active.

z-treeview/return-object.description: When `true` will make `v-model`, `active.sync` and `open.sync` return the complete object instead of just the key

z-treeview/rounded.description: Provides an alternative active style for `v-treeview` node. Only visible when `activatable` is `true` and should not be used in conjunction with the `shaped` prop.

z-treeview/search.description: The search model for filtering results

z-treeview/selectable.description: Will render a checkbox next to each node allowing them to be selected

z-treeview/selected-color.description: The color of the selection checkbox

z-treeview/selection-type.description: Controls how the treeview selects nodes. There are two modes available: 'leaf' and 'independent'

z-treeview/shaped.description: Provides an alternative active style for `v-treeview` node. Only visible when `activatable` is `true` and should not be used in conjunction with the `rounded` prop.

z-treeview/transition.description: Applies a transition when nodes are opened and closed

z-treeview/value.description: Allows one to control which nodes are selected. The array consists of the `item-key` of each selected item. Is used with `@input` event to allow for `v-model` binding.

z-treeview-node/activatable.description: Allows user to mark a node as active by clicking on it

z-treeview-node/active-class.description: The class applied to the node when active

z-treeview-node/expand-icon.description: Icon used to indicate that a node can be expanded

z-treeview-node/indeterminate-icon.description: Icon used when node is in an indeterminate state. Only visible when `selectable` is `true`.

z-treeview-node/item.description: Item object used to build the node

z-treeview-node/item-children.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its children

z-treeview-node/item-disabled.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains the disabled state of the item

z-treeview-node/item-key.description: Property on supplied `items` used to keep track of node state. The value of this property has to be unique among all items.

z-treeview-node/item-text.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its label text

z-treeview-node/level.description: Property designating how deep the node is from the root of the treeview

z-treeview-node/load-children.description: A function used when dynamically loading children. If this prop is set, then the supplied function will be run if expanding an item that has a `item-children` property that is an empty array. Supports returning a Promise.

z-treeview-node/loading-icon.description: Icon used when node is in a loading state

z-treeview-node/off-icon.description: Icon used when node is not selected. Only visible when `selectable` is `true`.

z-treeview-node/on-icon.description: Icon used when leaf node is selected or when a branch node is fully selected. Only visible when `selectable` is `true`.

z-treeview-node/open-on-click.description: When `true` will cause nodes to be opened by clicking anywhere on it, instead of only opening by clicking on expand icon. When using this prop with `activatable` you will be unable to mark nodes with children as active.

z-treeview-node/selectable.description: Will render a checkbox next to each node allowing them to be selected

z-treeview-node/selected-color.description: The color of the selection checkbox

z-treeview-node/shaped.description: Provides an alternative active style for `v-treeview` node. Only visible when `activatable` is `true` and should not be used in conjunction with the `rounded` prop.

z-treeview-node/transition.description: Applies a transition when nodes are opened and closed

z-virtual-scroll/bench.description: The number of items **outside** the user view that are rendered (even if they are **not** viewable); to help prevent empty white space when scrolling *fast*.

z-virtual-scroll/height.description: Height of the component as a css value

z-virtual-scroll/item-height.description: Height in pixels of the items to display

z-virtual-scroll/items.description: The array of items to display

z-virtual-scroll/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

z-virtual-scroll/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

z-virtual-scroll/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

z-virtual-scroll/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

z-virtual-scroll/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

z-window/active-class.description: The **active-class** applied to children when they are activated.

z-window/continuous.description: If `true`, window will "wrap around" from the last item to the first, and from the first item to the last

z-window/dark.description: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

z-window/light.description: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

z-window/mandatory.description: Forces a value to always be selected (if available).

z-window/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

z-window/multiple.description: Allow multiple selections. The **value** prop must be an _array_.

z-window/next-icon.description: Icon used for the "next" button if `show-arrows` is `true`

z-window/prev-icon.description: Icon used for the "prev" button if `show-arrows` is `true`

z-window/show-arrows-on-hover.description: Display the "next" and "prev" buttons on hover. `show-arrows` MUST ALSO be set.

z-window/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

z-window/touch.description: Provide a custom **left** and **right** function when swiped left or right.

z-window/value.description: The designated model value for the component.

z-window/vertical.description: Uses a vertical transition when changing windows.

z-window-item/active-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active. You can find more information about the [**active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

z-window-item/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

z-window-item/eager.description: Will force the components content to render on mounted. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

z-window-item/transition.description: The transition used when the component progressing through items. Can be one of the [built in transitions](/styles/transitions) or one your own.

z-window-item/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, the index will be used.
